name: IF YOU SEEK AMY
description: Ahhh...finally another reductive syntax word crystal! This one is by far one of my favorites. Based on a song of a similar title, written by Max Martin for Britney Spears back in 2008. When we reduce the title down we begin to see through the charade of language to perceive the true meaning of what she's singing about. She's not talking about if someone is seeking a person named Amy; she's looking to have sex. The song itself isn't great per se, but the message behind the title is nothing short of wordplay genius. It's not often you come upon wordplay gold to not showcase it and present it to the world, all spelled out. (pun intended)
